questions.text: Find the magnitude of vector a⃗ = 3î + 4ĵ.
If a⃗ = 2î + 3ĵ + k̂ and b⃗ = î - ĵ + 2k̂, find a⃗ + b⃗.
Find the unit vector in the direction of a⃗ = 2î + 2ĵ + k̂.

questions.explanation:
Standard unit vectors are perpendicular.
î · ĵ = |î||ĵ|cos 90°
= 1 × 1 × 0 = 0

questions.text: If a⃗ = î + 2ĵ + 3k̂ and b⃗ = 2î + ĵ - k̂, find a⃗ · b⃗.
Two vectors a⃗ and b⃗ are perpendicular if:
questions.explanation:
Perpendicular vectors:
a⃗ · b⃗ = |a⃗||b⃗|cos 90° = 0

Therefore, a⃗ · b⃗ = 0

Standard result:
î × ĵ = k̂

(Using right-hand rule or cyclic order)

questions.text: If a⃗ × b⃗ = 0⃗, then vectors a⃗ and b⃗ are:
questions.explanation:
a⃗ × b⃗ = |a⃗||b⃗|sin θ n̂

If a⃗ × b⃗ = 0⃗, then sin θ = 0
θ = 0° or 180°

Therefore, a⃗ and b⃗ are parallel.

questions.text: Three vectors a⃗, b⃗, c⃗ are coplanar if:
questions.explanation:
Vectors are coplanar if scalar triple product = 0

[a⃗ b⃗ c⃗] = a⃗ · (b⃗ × c⃗) = 0

Using cyclic order:
î × ĵ = k̂
ĵ × k̂ = î
k̂ × î = ĵ

Therefore, ĵ × k̂ = î

questions.text: Find the projection of a⃗ = 2î + 3ĵ + k̂ on b⃗ = î + 2ĵ + 2k̂.
Volume of parallelepiped with edges a⃗, b⃗, c⃗ is:
questions.explanation:
Volume of parallelepiped with coterminous edges a⃗, b⃗, c⃗:

V = |[a⃗ b⃗ c⃗]|
= |a⃗ · (b⃗ × c⃗)|
